originalText.text:
Good cozy library.
It‚Äôs not big. There‚Äôs only 1 floor available.
There‚Äôre some tables with plugs.
Clean.
1 restroom and you need to ask the front desk for key. Clean.
It‚Äôs close to the ferry and the seaside with Great views. I took ferry here from Jersey City, and the view was great üëç

The downside might be there‚Äôs only 1 restroom, and sometimes it can be crazy here since reading area is on the same floor of children area.

originalText.text: Small, cozy library with only 1 floor.  Staff is friendly and helpful; I go there to work and it's great.  The downside is that some people that attend the adult side of the library have a bad odor.   Unsure if they are homeless, but their appearance and body odor sure appear as homeless.  It's a little unnerving because I can't concentrate on my work because I'm unsure what their next action will be.  I leave a little earlier than I'd like to because of the bad odor and uneasiness.

originalText.text: This library or rather the staff here are a complete joke.  The programming listed on their calendar is never correct or updated and parents with strollers and small kids are left locked out, left standing in the cold because apparently someone decided to not show up that they and the program was canceled.  Staff purposely ignore parents knocking on the door wanting to know what‚Äôs happening. Not to mention, half the time when checking in books, the don‚Äôt scan them properly and does not show returned on your account requiring follow up to have them remove them. Also have witnessed numerous fights amongst the unhoused using the library computers which happen to be on the same floor as the children area.

originalText.text:
To everyone complaining about the noise level kids make at the library: imagine thinking that you need to be at the library more than actual children who still have lots to learn!
Guess what? These kids are here to find knowledge, they‚Äôre here to find books, they‚Äôre here to do kids activities and they‚Äôre here because we pay our damn taxes.
If you need to study and it‚Äôs too loud for you, stay home? Why can‚Äôt you stay in your room? Go by the water. Anywhere with no kids. A library should always give preference to the kids because they‚Äôre OUR FUTURE GENERATION.

And to the racist lady calling midwestern kids white milk curds or whatever, I‚Äôm not even from Midwest, but you‚Äôre a racist hater, see if you like the Washington heights library better then.

originalText.text: Recommended. New, compact library with ample seating, many PCs and an excellent children‚Äôs section. Great option post Asphalt Green.
